title: Food Vax: Study confirms development of oral MRNA vaccine thats produced in-cows milk, page 1
cleaned_text:
The chicken egg can be used to give immunity to calves when the chickens are exposed to a virus, so since milk also carries antigen chemistry to give the young immunity, I suppose that it could be used to carry immunity to those who drink the milk. 

 

 This sounds rational that it will work. If the vaccine is not injected right into the body with a needle, it might be safer to injest it this way. I don't think I would get the cytokine storm from consuming the vaccine, but I am also allergic to milk to start with...not lactose intolerant..I get a pretty high fever if I drink three glasses of it and a headache from hell unless I take a proteinase with it. 

 

 I cannot tell you if it will be safer than injecting the vaccine or a nasal spray. I have not seen the research on it or tested on myself and I gave up taking vaccines since I have had problems with them.
